CatDescriptText: Mr. James (Jim) Lewis, Eat 'n' Park employee, Carnegie and Mrs. Rose Willis, Gulf Oil employee, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 14, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think political leaders, who have been granted the power of seeking or dispensing patronage should "take care" of their immediate family and relatives before they do such supporters like committee men and committee women and financial contributors?"  Mr. Lewis' answer reads: "I don't know much about politics...However, I know that political leaders do take care of their immediate families first."  Mrs. Willis' answer reads: "No, they should care for people who put them into office, and then if anything in left, they should give the jobs to their immediate family."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of James "Jim" Lewis wearing light colored button down short sleeve collared shirt, standing in front of Isalys; Portrait of Rose Willis wearing light colored coat with brooch and eyeglasses, holding dark gloves, standing in front of Isalys
